channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Zuckerberg’s new policy chief warns EU Meta will run to Trump whenever the tech giant feels it’s being unfairly punished by Brussels
item.description: The warning comes after Zuckerberg pledged to join President Trump in pushing back on governments around the world that go after American companies.

item.title: The New York Times Wins 3 Polk Awards
item.description: The Times was honored for an investigation into extremism in Israel, coverage of the civil war in Sudan and a narrative about a Russian soldier who de...

item.title: The Tisch family just appointed its third generation of CEO at $18.5 billion Loews Corporation—he’s pledging to focus on one job
item.description: The Tisch family count the New York Giants and Loews Corporation as among their interests.

item.title: Trump’s USAID Cuts Halt Agent Orange Victims Program in Vietnam
item.description: Fifty years after the Vietnam War ended, President Trump’s gutting of foreign aid has halted American efforts to address a toxic legacy and build a st...

item.title: ‘Here We Go Again’: Kentucky Residents Face More Destruction and Anxiety From Storms
item.description: The flood damage over the weekend was not as catastrophic as some previous climate disasters in the state. But the rains still brought widespread havo...

item.title: Republicans Want Lower Taxes. The Hard Part Is Choosing What to Cut.
item.description: House Republicans are preparing to adopt a plan that puts a $4.5 trillion limit on the size of the tax cut, but even that will not be enough for some ...

item.title: Forget about RTO—companies are getting distracted with mandates and screwing up these 5 core work practices
item.description: Return-to-office mandates won’t necessarily make your employees more productive.

item.title: ‘S.N.L.’ Celebrates 50 Years With Star-Studded Prime-Time Special
item.description: Stage and audience alike at Studio 8H were packed with cast, alumni and other celebrities in a night that was in turns sweet and self-satirizing.

item.title: Zakia Jafri, Who Sought Justice for Victims of Indian Riots, Dies at 86
item.description: For two decades, she waged a legal battle against government officials in India after her husband was brutally killed in Gujarati in 2002.

item.title: Pope Francis Will Remain in Hospital for ‘Complex’ Clinical Issue
item.description: Pope Francis was admitted on Friday with a respiratory infection. The announcement on Monday did not provide further detail, but raised fresh concerns...

item.title: Israel Says It Will Keep Troops ‘Temporarily’ in 5 Points in Lebanon
item.description: The announcement raised the specter of renewed fighting in southern Lebanon between Israel and Hezbollah, the Lebanese militia.

item.title: South Korean Actress Kim Sae-ron Is Found Dead
item.description: The 24-year-old star, once a prolific child actor, appeared at the Cannes Film Festival and on Netflix, until a drunk-driving incident in 2022 deraile...

item.title: Norway announces $855 million funding for humanitarian NGOs amid Trump’s dismantling of USAID
item.description: The Norwegian funding had been intended to work alongside USAID, and humanitarian groups warned it wouldn't fill the black hole being left by the U.S.

item.title: These founders and investors want the longevity industry to cater to women—whatever their budget
item.description: Male biohackers shouldn't dominate the longevity conversation.

item.title: Israel Says It Will Keep Troops ‘Temporarily’ in 5 Points in Lebanon
